intro: Thesium monophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a reddish or purple hue. Thesium monophyllum is typically found in dry, sunny environments and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
